revised_title: New Pneumatical Experiments on Respiration and the Effects of Air Pressure on Animals
tldr: The author, Robert Boyle, conducts experiments on the effects of air pressure on various animals, including ducks, vipers, and frogs, in an attempt to understand the process of respiration and the impact of air pressure on their survival. The experiments reveal the importance of air for the survival of these animals and the role of their respiratory systems in adapting to different environments.
